snippet.title: The home stretch: How Pixar wrapped 'Monsters University'
snippet.description: Pixar's films can take four or five years to complete. But what does it take to close the deal? CNET has the scoop.

snippet.title: A visit to the heart of European space research
snippet.description: Road Trip 2011: An hour south of Amsterdam, the European Space Agency maintains ESTEC, its primary environmental testing and research hub. This is where ESA readies satellites for space and much more.

snippet.title: Data breach at University of Maryland exposes 300K records
snippet.description: School president apologies for a "sophisticated" security breach that exposed the sensitive personal information faculty, staff, and students at the school since 1998.

snippet.title: Audi's RS 5, A6 are treat on European roads
snippet.description: Road Trip 2011: After driving more than 3,000 miles across Europe in two of Audi's latest models this summer, CNET reporter Daniel Terdiman had a hard time handing back the keys.

snippet.title: Our cars: The European Grand Prix - Leon Edition
snippet.description: We take our trusty long termer out to the legendary NÃ¼rburgring GP circuit.

snippet.title: TiVo's European push tallies 2.5 million subscribers
snippet.description: The DVR maker manages to make a dent in Europe by working with cable providers Com Hem, Virgin Media, and ONO.

snippet.title: AT&T throws cold water on European acquisitions
snippet.description: Chief Financial Officer John Stephens says "the window of opportunity for owning assets is closing," and says AT&T will focus more on the US, including expanding its GigaPower fiber service.

snippet.title: European antitrust chief defends deal with Google
snippet.description: Joaquin Almunia says he stands behind an antitrust agreement with the search giant despite criticism from rival businesses.

snippet.title: Google updates its maps for 10 European countries
snippet.description: The Ground Truth project, a subset of Google Maps, has now mapped 40 countries.
